channel.title: Enable ClearType! 56K Warning!
channel.description:
Hi guys.
Have you ever wanted your font like vista on your computer not just some programs like IE7? Well now you can by following this tutorial you will have your computer with ClearType enabled in no time!
Anyway on with the tutorial,
1. Fire up Internet Explorer , "What! IE! That is rubbish, Firefox ftw!" you say, well because Micro$oft want to use their software you have to use it, so please don't moan at me lol.
[img]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/9633/cleartype1pngyb1.png[/img]
2. Goto Google or your favourite seach engine and type in "Turn On ClearType" or something similar and of course without the speechmarks.
[img]http://i11.tinypic.com/4tibatz.png[/img]
3 When you a page with a link like the one highlighted in purple click it.
[img]http://i19.tinypic.com/4otsy80.png[/img]
4. You should see a site like the one in the picture. Once it's all loaded up an information bar should pop-up saying about how it wants to install an activex program to enable ClearType. Right click and let it install activex controls and then you will see another pop-up saying "Install" and "Don't Install" Of course press install. The page will then refresh so you will know when it is done. As I have it already this won't happen But I am certain you will be able to work it out from my detailed instructions.
[img]http://i18.tinypic.com/67ehrop.png[/img]
5. Now, Scroll down you should see a check box saying "Turn On ClearType" Check it and find the button saying Next and click it.
[img]http://i10.tinypic.com/66ongg2.png[/img]
6. Next, you will be greeted with two boxes, this time the choice is up to you and what you feel looks nices because on my monitor one looks nice and one looks like I need glasses, so obviusly I chose the nice-looking one.
[img]http://i7.tinypic.com/4tuk6j4.png[/img]
7. Finally, the last step is again up to what feels best to you. 6 boxes will be presented infront of you. Choose What one looks best and press the finish button.
[img]http://i15.tinypic.com/6aknn8j.png[/img]
You now have ClearType enabled on your computer. Enjoy!
Surakon

item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

it just makes it a little blur … sucks.

Yes it does, it hurts my eyes using ClearType, why the heckwould you want it on Firefox?

Read full topic

item.title: Enable ClearType! 56K Warning!
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Right click on your desktop
Click properties
Click Appearance
Click Effects
Cleartype option

Read full topic

Does it just enhance the font?[/quote]it just makes it a little blur … sucks.

item.title: Enable ClearType! 56K Warning!
item.dc:creator: @murphj murphj
item.description:
@murphj wrote:

I know this is reaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaally old, so i’m sorry But you can do this more easily by right clicking on desktop > properties, then click the Appearance tab, then the Effects button, and then check the box called ‘Use the following method to smooth edges of screen fonts’ and then use ClearType.

Read full topic

item.title: Enable ClearType! 56K Warning!
item.dc:creator: @Surakon Surakon
item.description:
@Surakon wrote:

Hi guys.

Have you ever wanted your font like vista on your computer not just some programs like IE7? Well now you can by following this tutorial you will have your computer with ClearType enabled in no time!

Anyway on with the tutorial,

  1. Fire up Internet Explorer , “What! IE! That is rubbish, Firefox ftw!” you say, well because Micro$oft want to use their software you have to use it, so please don’t moan at me lol.

  1. Goto Google or your favourite seach engine and type in “Turn On ClearType” or something similar and of course without the speechmarks.

3 When you a page with a link like the one highlighted in purple click it.

  1. You should see a site like the one in the picture. Once it’s all loaded up an information bar should pop-up saying about how it wants to install an activex program to enable ClearType. Right click and let it install activex controls and then you will see another pop-up saying “Install” and “Don’t Install” Of course press install. The page will then refresh so you will know when it is done. As I have it already this won’t happen But I am certain you will be able to work it out from my detailed instructions.

67ehrop.png799×601

  1. Now, Scroll down you should see a check box saying “Turn On ClearType” Check it and find the button saying Next and click it.

66ongg2.png800×601

  1. Next, you will be greeted with two boxes, this time the choice is up to you and what you feel looks nices because on my monitor one looks nice and one looks like I need glasses, so obviusly I chose the nice-looking one.

  1. Finally, the last step is again up to what feels best to you. 6 boxes will be presented infront of you. Choose What one looks best and press the finish button.

6aknn8j.png801×599

You now have ClearType enabled on your computer. Enjoy!
